text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to explicitly address the impact of reporting on racial or ethnic pay disparities. Section 2, under 'Limits' for equal pay reporting, states: 'If race/ethnicity data are not collected (lawfully and safely) or intersectional reporting isn\u2019t required, racial gaps and compounded disparities can remain hidden.' Furthermore, Section 3, 'Addressing systemic gender and racial gaps specifically,' explicitly discusses racial pay gaps, noting that effectiveness is weaker due to data constraints but improves when regimes require 'race/ethnicity pay reporting where legal' and use 'intersectional' breakdowns. This directly addresses the impact of reporting on racial disparities.", "criterion_id": "73113ada-8713-4898-9f95-143017841cf0"}
